subject: Travel
title: The Northwest Passage
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Northwest Passage.

hook.text: For 400 years, explorers searched for a sea route through the Arctic connecting Atlantic to Pacific.

buildup.text: Dozens of expeditions tried and failed. Many ended in death, starvation, or ships crushed by ice.

discovery.text: In 1845, Sir John Franklin's expedition vanished with 129 men. It became history's greatest mystery.

twist.text: Inuit testimony and recent discoveries suggest the crew resorted to cannibalism before dying.

climax.text: Roald Amundsen finally completed the passage in 1906, taking three years in a tiny fishing boat.

punchline.text: The route that killed hundreds was conquered by patience.

quiz.question: Who first successfully navigated the Northwest Passage?
